moves.1. e4 e5: We move up our kings' pawns...
moves.2. Nf3 Nc6: ...then develop our knights, mine to defend my pawn.
moves.3. c3 d5: Now I attack his first pawn...
moves.6... Ng6: ...so I move it out of harm's way.
moves.11. Be2 Bd6: ...and bring up my other bishop to contest the f4 square...
moves.14. Ra6: ...allowing his rook to advance to my 3rd rank...
moves.15... Ng8e7: ...so I defend with my other knight.
moves.16. Na3: He lines up my stray pawn...
moves.16... O-O: ...and I castle kingside to unpin my knight...
moves.17. Qb3: ...and his queen advances onto the a2-g8 diagonal...
moves.17... Rf6: ...but WHAT was I thinking here looking for an exchange of rooks???
moves.18. Rd6+: He moves his rook to expose my king...
moves.18... Kf8: ...so I move him to try to give him more running room...
moves.21... f4: ...but what was I thinking, trying to go for his e-pawn??
moves.22. Rf1: He lines a two-pronged attack on my f-pawn...
moves.24. f5 Nh4: ...but mine must get out of the way...
moves.27. g3: ...but failing to capture my knight with his queen...
moves.27... Re8: ...allows me to pin her down to the e-file...
moves.28. Qxe8+: ...which leaves my opponent with no choice but to take my rook...
moves.30... Rb7: ...so I also retreat my rook to the second rank...
moves.33... Kd7 34. d5 Kd6: My king tracks down his d-pawn...
moves.35... Nf5: ...so I bring my knight towards my king to help...
moves.39... Nxc4: ...but WHAT was I thinking, removing with the knight...
moves.40... Kc5: So my king moves back to marshal the c- and d-pawns...
moves.41. Kb2: ...and as his king hunts down my a-pawn...
moves.41... g5: ...I push up my g-pawn to go for a counter-promotion.
moves.42. Ka3 h5: Now I do likewise to my h-pawn to stop his from getting too far...
moves.44. Ka5: ...but he declines to take my g-pawn...
moves.44... gxh3: ...so my pawn removes his and has a clear run. This game was littered with so many mistakes, especially schoolboy errors, and I was extremely fortunate to emerge victorious.
